## Forma 2

$$\large   \int_{2}^{100} x^{2} + 2x+4$$

$$
\Large    \sum_{1}^{100} \frac{1}{x}(2^{x})
$$

$$
\LARGE   \sum_{1}^{100} \frac{1}{x}(2^{x})
$$

$$
\Large f(x) = \frac{1}{\sqrt{2\pi\sigma^2}} \exp\left( -\frac{(x - \mu)^2}{2\sigma^2} \right)
$$

# Grafico de Dispersón
plot(cars,
     main = "Distancia vs. velocidad",

     ylab = "Distancia",

     cex = 1.5
     )
